business.headline: Anil Ambani offers to give virtual statement in money laundering caseReliance Group chairman Anil Ambani has offered to give his statement through video conference to the Enforcement Directorate, following his absence twice in a FEMA probe related to a 2010 highway project.

US dumps the penny, but some of them can still earn you $5 millionThe US Mint officially ended production of the one-cent coin on November 12. US Treasurer Brandon Beach struck the last penny at the Philadelphia Mint, marking the end of the 232-year-old coin that first entered circulation in 1793.

Is India becoming the world's next big consumption powerhouse?While many economies struggle with sluggish demand, India is quietly powering ahead. A booming middle class, strong domestic spending, and favourable demographics are transforming the country into a consumption force that global brands can no longer ignore.

Why has Bitcoin fallen to $93,000 after touching $126,000 in October?The cryptocurrency has now lost more than 10% in the past week, marking its third straight weekly decline. Bitcoin, along with Ethereum, XRP, Cardano, Solana and other major altcoins witnessed a decline in their prices.

Is your Digital Life Certificate rejected? Here's how you can fix itMany pensioners use the Digital Life Certificate to complete their yearly verification from home, but rejections are still common. If your certificate has been turned down, here's a simple look at why it happens and how you can sort it out.
Explained: Why Tata Motors PV shares crashed 6% todayJLR suffered a major setback in Q2, prompting the company to slash its full-year EBIT margin guidance to 0–2% from the earlier 5–7%.

Which cities are seeing a rise in office spaces, and whyIndia's economic story — steady growth, stable demand, and improving infrastructure — is not only creating demand for office spaces but also enabling developers to capitalise on real estate opportunities.

India to source 10% of annual LPG imports from US under first-ever dealThe contract is India's first-ever structured LPG purchase agreement with the US, and is benchmarked to Mont Belvieu, the key US pricing hub for LPG.

Fujiyama Power Systems IPO Day 3: Check latest GMP, subscription status and moreThe IPO, priced between Rs 216 and Rs 228 per share, aims to raise Rs 828 crore. This includes a fresh issue of Rs 600 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 228 crore by promoters Yogesh Dua and Pawan Kumar Garg.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 2: Check latest GMP and should you apply?Capillary Technologies' IPO has opened to a cautious start with weak early subscription and a cooling GMP, but long-term brokerage views remain positive, making investors weigh short-term sentiment against long-term potential.

Why buying health insurance should be your first move in personal financeHealth insurance is often treated as an afterthought, yet a single medical emergency can undo years of savings. With rising healthcare costs, early coverage has become the most essential starting point in personal finance.

Sensex, Nifty open in green as earnings optimism lifts sentimentAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 87.27 points at 84,650.05, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 24.50 points to 25,934.55. Broader market indices were mixed in early trade.

Tenneco Clean Air IPO allotment today: Check status, GMP, and listing detailsInvestors can check their allotment status using either the BSE website or the MUFG Intime India portal. The IPO saw heavy bidding across categories. Overall, it was subscribed 61.79 times.

Trump invests at least $82m in bonds, including sectors boosted by his own policiesDonald Trump purchased over $82 million in corporate and municipal bonds from late August to early October. These investments include sectors benefiting from his administration's policies, raising questions about potential conflicts of interest.

Millennials vs Gen Z: How their crypto portfolios and risk appetites differMillennials and Gen Z are both active in the world of crypto, yet they approach it from very different angles. Their portfolios, strategies and risk appetite reveal how differently each generation views money, technology and long-term investing.

How to execute a will the right way, so your family avoids delays and fightsThe truth is, writing a will is only half the job. The real work begins afterwards. One missing document, one unclear clause or one forgotten instruction is enough to turn a simple inheritance into months of delay and dispute.

Expert explains why your 12% equity returns aren't realMost people believe a 12% equity return is strong growth, but according to an expert, the actual gain after inflation and taxes is much smaller. Here's why your money may not be growing as much as you think.
Fresh ED summons to Anil Ambani in fraud case after he skips second dateIn a continued push to seek clarity in the ongoing investigation, the ED has served another notice to Anil Ambani.
Sensex, Nifty bounce back after volatile day as markets cheer Bihar winThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 84.11 points to close at 84,562.78, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.90 points to end at 25,910.05.

Why safety worries are growing for India's top executivesThe report shows that 71% of corporate security chiefs in India believe the risk of violence against chief executives has increased in the last two years, marking the highest level recorded globally.

entertainment.headline: Sanchith's debut 'Mango Pachcha' locks release date, confirms Kichcha Sudeep Sanchith Sanjeev, nephew of Kichcha Sudeep, to debut in Kannada cinema with crime thriller 'Mango Pachcha', directed by Vivek and slated for release during Sankranti festival in 2026.

Actor Meera Vasudevan ends third marriage: In most peaceful phase of life Malayalam actor Meera Vasudevan has officially announced her separation from cinematographer Vipin Puthiyankam. She revealed that she has been single since August 2025.

Deepika says she's rejected big cheques: They offer money and think it's enough Deepika Padukone opened up about why she has turned down massive paycheques for authenticity and meaningful storytelling. She also discussed choosing roles that feel true, embracing her identity as a 'global Indian'.

Dhurandhar: Akshaye Khanna's bloodied first look as Apex Predator is out Akshaye Khanna's first look from 'Dhurandhar' was unveiled ahead of the trailer launch. The film promises intense action and stars Ranveer Singh, releasing on December 5.

Kanu Behl on Agra getting limited screens: It's time people speak up Filmmaker Kanu Behl spoke to India Today about his struggle to find multiplex screens for his film 'Agra'. In an exclusive interview, he urged structural reforms to safeguard independent cinema in India.

Bharti Singh's baby shower: Jannat Zubair, Jasmin-Aly, Tejasswi and others attend Actors Jannat Zubair, Jasmin Bhasin, Aly Goni, Tejasswi Prakash, Krushna Abhishek and Kashmera Shah recently came together to celebrate Bharti Singh's baby shower ceremony.

Rasha Thadani set for Telugu debut opposite Mahesh Babu's nephew Jaya Krishna Bollywood newcomer Rasha Thadani, who went viral with the song 'Uyi Amma', is officially entering Telugu cinema in Ajay Bhupathi's new romantic drama opposite Jaya Krishna Ghattamaneni.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 70: Thanuja's solo-game narrative cracks, Gaurav eliminated Sunday's episode of 'Bigg Boss Telugu 9' delivered confrontation, emotional misfires, celebrity energy and one more elimination, marking the complete exit of the Firestorm batch.

Humans in the Loop wins Sloan Grant, enters Oscars race 'Humans in the Loop' has received the Film Independent Sloan Distribution Grant, securing US release support. The film now enters the 98th Academy Awards race.

Sholay's original ending: The climax India never saw, and reason it was scrapped As 'Sholay' returns to theatres in a restored 4K version, audiences will finally see the film's original ending that never saw the light of the day. Here's what was in the climax and why it was scrapped.

De De Pyaar De 2 box office Day 3: Ajay Devgn's film beats Son of Sardaar 2 Ajay Devgn and R Madhavan's latest film registered its highest single-day earnings on Sunday, pushing the sequel's opening weekend totals ahead of Devgn's recent releases.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Another shocking eviction, Cockroach Sudhi eliminated Cockroach Sudhi's eviction from Bigg Boss Kannada season 12 comes as a shocker as he was one of the favourites to win the show at the start of the season.
Tom Cruise, Dolly Parton, Debbie Allen, Wynn Thomas receive honorary Oscars Tom Cruise, Dolly Parton, Debbie Allen and Wynn Thomas received honorary Oscars at the 2025 Governors Awards. .

Fukrey duo Pulkit-Varun back in comedy Rahu Ketu, Check out 2026 release date The release date of the upcoming comedy film 'Rahu Ketu' was announced today. The film combines folklore with contemporary humour and features Pulkit Samrat and Varun Sharma, known for their work in the 'Fukrey' franchise, with Shalini Pandey.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: No eviction, housemates get electric shocks Rohit Shetty brought a lively energy to Bigg Boss 19's Weekend Ka Vaar in Salman Khan's absence. Sunday's episode featured a comedic roast, interactive tasks, candid discussions and the announcement of no eliminations.

'Laalo – Krishna Sada Sahaayate' is biggest Gujarati hit in India. See the stats The devotional drama 'Laalo – Krishna Sada Sahaayate' has become the highest-grossing Gujarati film of all time in India, according to trade report

Dhanush may direct Rajinikanth in Kamal Haasan's Thalaivar 173: Report After the unexpected exit of director Sundar C, rumours are rife that Dhanush might just take over Rajinikanth's 'Thalaivar 173' as the director. The film marks the superstar's iconic collaboration with Kamal Haasan's production.

Pankaj Tripathi launches theatre banner with daughter's stage debut in Lailaaj Actor Pankaj Tripathi and his wife, Mridula Tripathi, have launched a new theatre banner Roopkatha Rangmanch. Their daughter Aashi is set to make her stage debut in the musical comedy 'Lailaaj'.

Prabhas's Fauzi to be a two-part epic on forgotten heroes: Hanu Raghavapudi Prabhas steps into the role of a fearless soldier in Hanu Raghavapudi's ambitious two-part film 'Fauzi'. With a striking first poster, the period drama promises a visually grand, emotionally rich tale inspired by forgotten heroes.

general news.headline: Ousted Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death for crimes against humanity Live UpdatesBangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal has sentenced former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to death for crimes against humanity linked to last year's student uprising that toppled her government.

Dr Umar a shoe bomber, traces of 'mother of Satan' explosive found in i20: SourcesAccording to sources, fresh forensic and material evidence recovered from the blast site has shifted the focus sharply onto a shoe found inside Umar's i20 car.

42 Umrah pilgrims from Telangana killed in Saudi Arabia bus–tanker collisionAt least 42 Indian Umrah pilgrims from Hyderabad died after their bus collided with a tanker in Saudi Arabia. Telangana officials contacted MEA for details. MP Asaduddin Owaisi sought swift updates and assistance.

Bengaluru woman loses Rs 32 crore in digital arrest, held on video call for monthsThe fraudsters posing as CBI officers kept her under constant Skype surveillance, coerced her into making 187 bank transfers.

Sholay's original ending: The climax India never saw, and reason it was scrappedAs 'Sholay' returns to theatres in a restored 4K version, audiences will finally see the film's original ending that never saw the light of the day. Here's what was in the climax and why it was scrapped.

Live: Hasina, ex-home minister get death, ex-police chief spared the nooseSheikh Hasina Verdict News Live Updates: The International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) in Bangladesh has delivered its verdict. It has convicted ousted PM Sheikh Hasina and her former home minister for their alleged role in violent suppression of the 2024 protests. Hasina has been sentenced to death. Dhaka has been turned into a fortress as the army, police and paramilitaries have been deployed across the nation.

As mahila shakti powers NDA win, a beti and behen's anguish haunts RJDIn the week women rewrote Bihar's political map, the RJD was forced to confront a crisis written by its own daughters, a contradiction far more damaging than its electoral defeat.

Suspiciously low orders: How Karnataka milk body busted fake Nandini ghee racketKarnataka Milk Federation officials busted a fake ghee racket run by an authorised distributor in Bengaluru. The distributor allegedly diluted genuine Nandini ghee with palm oil and sold it to parlours.

Deepika says she's rejected big cheques: They offer money and think it's enoughDeepika Padukone opened up about why she has turned down massive paycheques for authenticity and meaningful storytelling. She also discussed choosing roles that feel true, embracing her identity as a 'global Indian'.

Ex-Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina convicted: What are the charges against herWhile pronouncing the verdict, the tribunal, originally set up under Hasina's own government, made some sensational observations, saying that Hasina ordered killings of protesters and even denied them medical aid.
Boy, 5, falls to death from 22nd-floor balcony after door auto-locks in GurugramThe five-year-old boy, only child of his parents, lost his balance and fell from the 22nd-floor balcony.

Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj isn't dead, it's born really now. Here's whyPrashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj has drawn a blank in the Bihar Assembly polls, but those writing its political obituary should stop right away. The debutant's 3.4% vote share, which is more than that of the Left parties and the AIMIM combined, is a significant indicator of the traction it has. Though it lost deposits in most seats, it also has third-place finishes in over 54%of the seats contested.

Dining With The Kapoors: Aadar Jain jokes about Kareena Kapoor's favourite questionIn the 'Dining With The Kapoors' promo, Aadar Jain revealed cousin Kareena Kapoor Khan's favourite question. 'Dining With The Kapoors' will stream on Netflix from November 21, 2025.

Why young Indians living alone are learning family recipesHave you ever wondered why you suddenly feel like picking up a pan and cooking a wholesome meal at home instead of opening a ready-to-eat pack or ordering in? Something has definitely changed, hasn't it?

Live: Nitish Kumar to resign as CM on Wednesday, day before swearing-inBihar is inching toward a new government after the National Democratic Alliance swept the 2025 assembly polls, taking 202 of 243 seats. The focus now shifts to how the coalition will shape its cabinet, with senior leaders indicating that the contours of the new administration should be finalised within the next two to three days. Even as the NDA is preparing to take charge, the RJD is battling a public rupture. Rohini Acharya, Lalu Prasad's daughter and Tejashwi Yadav's sister, declared she was quitting politics and distancing herself from the family. She accused key aides in Tejashwi's circle of mistreating her, deepening the crisis inside the party after facing a crushing defear in Bihar Assembly elections. Stay tuned with IndiaToday.in as we bring you the latest developments from Bihar.

Japan envoy tries Hyderabadi biryani in Telangana. His verdict is viralJapan's envoy to India tasted Hyderabadi biryani on a trip to Telangana and posted his review in a now-viral post on X.

Pope names Bangladesh over persecution of ChristiansPope Leo XIV has named Bangladesh among four countries where Christians face persecution. This highlights the Muhammad Yunus-led interim government's failure to protect minorities in the neighbouring country. Since Sheikh Hasina's ouster in August 2024, attacks on Hindus, Buddhists, and Christians have surged, with places of worship targeted by Islamist groups.

Viral pics show US politician looking at 'porn' on flight, he blames Elon MuskThe controversy began when a fellow passenger discreetly photographed the US politician seated with his iPad, which appeared to display a sequence of suggestive pictures of women in lingerie.
India's first wearable air purifier gains buzz amid Delhi's toxic airAs Delhi's smog season worsens, a new Indian innovation promises cleaner air on the go.

Feeling overwhelmed? The 5-5-5 rule pulls you back in secondsOverthinking has almost become second nature to some of us. And when a thought spiral begins, coming out becomes a task. But there is one grounding technique that might just come in handy the next time you go down a rabbit hole.

Crashes, misfires, no GPS: Budget drone wins Isro's Mars challengeThe contest, themed "Fly Me on MARS," tasked students with developing an autonomous navigation system for aerial vehicles capable of operating without any external navigation aid such as GNSS, pseudolites, or reflector arrays on Mars.

India to source 10% of annual LPG imports from US under first-ever dealThe contract is India's first-ever structured LPG purchase agreement with the US, and is benchmarked to Mont Belvieu, the key US pricing hub for LPG.

Actor Meera Vasudevan ends third marriage: In most peaceful phase of lifeMalayalam actor Meera Vasudevan has officially announced her separation from cinematographer Vipin Puthiyankam. She revealed that she has been single since August 2025.

sports.headline: Watch: Karma hits Dominik Szoboszlai hard as Hungary knocked out by Ireland Dominik Szoboszlai's mocking celebration backfired as Ireland stunned Hungary to secure a spot in the play-offs for the World Cup qualifiers. The loss against the Irish side meant that Hungary were knocked out in the group stages.

Fear behind the turn: How Gautam Gambhir's pitch policy amplifies India's weakness India's historic home Test dominance is unravelling. A steep batting slump against spin and risky pitch tactics under Gautam Gambhir have exposed vulnerabilities, culminating in crushing defeats like the 2024 New Zealand series. Yet, the coach refuses to learn from mistakes.

IPL tougher than internationals? KL Rahul says captains are always questioned Opening up about the pressures of IPL leadership, KL Rahul said the demands of franchise cricket can be more draining than international duties, pointing to ownership-level scrutiny, relentless expectations and rapid team changes as major challenges modern players must navigate.

PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi overjoyed as Pakistan stun India in Rising Stars Asia Cup Mohsin Naqvi was thrilled with Pakistan Shaheens' comprehensive win over India in the Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025. The PCB chairman hailed the win and praised the performance from the team.

Pakistan board hands Sarfaraz Ahmed full responsibility of Shaheens, U19 setup The Pakistan Cricket Board has handed former captain Sarfaraz Ahmed full responsibility for overseeing the Pakistan Shaheens and Under-19 teams, marking a significant restructuring step as the board looks to strengthen its pathway programmes.

No.3 move could affect Washington Sundar's bowling in long run: Dinesh Karthik Dinesh Karthik believes that the move to bat at No. 3 could have a long-term impact on Washington Sundar's bowling. Sundar batted for the first time at No.3 during the Kolkata Test against South Africa.

Sam Konstas named in Australian Prime Minister's XI for Ashes warm-up vs England Young opener Sam Konstas, who was dropped from Australia's Ashes squad, has been named in the Australian Prime Minister's XI for the tour game against England, starting on November 29 in Canberra.

I am ready to die: Yuvraj's father Yograj Singh reveals battle with loneliness Former India cricketer Yuvraj Singh's father, Yograj Singh, has opened up about his loneliness and strained family ties. Despite his personal setbacks, the former all-rounder continues to stay connected to the game, working actively as a coach in Punjab.

Rajasthan confirm Rahul Dravid replacement, Sangakkara to double as head coach IPL 2026: Rajasthan Royals announced Kumar Sangakkara, their Director of Cricket, will double as head coach for the upcoming season. He will replace Rahul Dravid, who left after working with them for a season.

Masters of spin no more: Irfan Pathan feels Indian batters' skill on decline Irfan Pathan feels that the Indian batters are no longer the masters of playing spin as they lost the Kolkata Test to South Africa. Simon Harmer spun a web around the Indian batters as they crumbled and failed to chase 124 in the second innings.

RIP Test Cricket: Harbhajan slams Kolkata pitch after India suffer shock loss to SA Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh criticised the team management following India's defeat to South Africa in the opening Test at Eden Gardens, saying that the obsession with preparing rank turners is damaging both the spirit of Test cricket and the development of Indian players.

Despite his personal setbacks, the former all-rounder continues to stay connected to the game, working actively as a coach in Punjab.

Jannik Sinner beats Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets to retain ATP Finals titleJannik Sinner successfully defended his ATP Finals title by beating world No.1 Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(4), 7-5 in Turin. Despite Alcaraz taking the No.1 ranking, Sinner capped an exceptional season with another major win on home soil.

Bring back Mohammed Shami: Ganguly tells Gautam Gambhir after Kolkata Test lossSourav Ganguly has advised Gautam Gambhir to recall Mohammed Shami back into the Test team after the loss to South Africa in Kolkata. Shami last played for India in 2023 during the WTC final.

Cristiano Ronaldo set for record sixth World Cup as Portugal thrash Armenia 9-1Portugal booked their place at the 2026 FIFA World Cup with a decisive 9-1 victory over Armenia, giving Cristiano Ronaldo the chance to feature in a record sixth World Cup. Hat-tricks from Bruno Fernandes and João Neves headlined the dominant display.

Haaland-inspired Norway thump Italy 4-1 to end 28-year World Cup waitErling Haaland's two late goals propelled Norway to a 4–1 victory over Italy in Rome, confirming their qualification for the 2026 FIFA World Cup and ending a 28-year absence. Norway finished the group stage with a flawless record, while Italy faces another playoff challenge.

South Africa coach Conrad credits spin revolution for historic Test win in IndiaSouth Africa coach Shukri Conrad said he was delighted to see his spinners take charge in the first Test against India at the Eden Gardens. Conrad added that the performance showed his side is no longer defined solely as a "fast bowling country" and expressed hope that it will inspire more young slow bowlers back home.

Kris Srikkanth slams Gambhir's Kolkata pitch defence: I would have taken wickets hereFormer India selector Kris Srikkanth slammed Gautam Gambhir's assessment of the Kolkata pitch after India's loss to South Africa in the first Test in Kolkata. The Eden Gardens track came under the scanner after the match ended in just two and a half days.

Trolled for height, Bavuma stands tall to rewrite South Africa's Test legacy IND vs SA, 1st Test: Temba Bavuma has often faced trolling for his height, but the South African captain has risen above the odds to win in Kolkata and establish himself as one of his country's most successful Test skippers.

India defeated at their own game in Eden Test loss? South Africa's Temba Bavuma agreesSouth Africa captain Temba Bavuma's pointed post-match comments added fuel to the Eden Gardens pitch row after India's 30-run loss. He said India lost on the very surface they requested, as his side adapted better to the conditions.

PAK vs SL: Rizwan, Talat guide Pakistan to 6-wicket win, complete 3-0 whitewashPakistan beat Sri Lanka by 6 wickets in the third ODI to complete a 3-0 whitewash in the series. Mohammad Rizwan and Fakhar Zaman starred with half-centuries while Mohammad Wasim Jr picked up a 3-wicket haul.

India A vs Pakistan A controversy after Naman Dhir catch overruled: What's the rule?The India A vs Pakistan A clash saw fresh controversy after a stunning relay catch involving Nehal Wadhera and Naman Dhir was overruled. The decision followed cricket's updated boundary fielding laws, sparking confusion and strong reactions.

Rising Stars Asia Cup: Pakistan hammer India by 8 wickets as no handshake continuesIndia continued their 'no handshake' policy against arch-rivals Pakistan following an 8-wicket defeat in the Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025 in Doha.

India Loses to South Africa; Gambhir Defends Pitch, Ganguly Calls for 'Good Wickets'This special report covers the fallout from India's 30-run Test loss to South Africa at Eden Gardens, featuring an exclusive interview with CAB President Sourav Ganguly and analysis of India Head Coach Gautam Gambhir's press conference. The discussion centres on the controversial pitch, India's batting performance, and team strategy. Following the match, Gautam Gambhir stated, 'this is exactly the pitch we were looking for'.

Shubman Gill discharged from Kolkata hospital, unsure if he will travel to GuwahatiIndia Test captain Shubman Gill has been discharged from hospital and is recovering well after his neck injury at Eden Gardens. India now await clarity on his availability for the second Test after a costly defeat in his absence.

India's skill vs spin gone down: Former stars react after Kolkata Test defeatIndia's Eden Gardens defeat has prompted sharp reactions from former cricketers, who see deeper issues than a single collapse. Many believe the loss reflects declining spin-batting skills and lessons still unlearned since the New Zealand series setback.

IND A vs PAK A Highlights: Pakistan Shaheens beat India A by 8 wicketsIndia A vs Pakistan A, Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025 Highlights: Pakistan Shaheens have clinched a comfortable 8 wickets win against India, having done something their senior team has not been able to do since 2022.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
